Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma is back to entertain with his big sixes and classy fours as the action shifts to R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo for the three ODIs starting on Friday, August 2.
Virat Kohli is also back as the RO-KO pair is ready to weave their magic.
Dilshan Madushanka, the Mumbai Indians’ pacer who missed IPL 2024 with an injury, will look to continue his purple patch from the ODI World Cup where he picked up 21 wickets from nine matches.
The HITMAN joins hands with Gautam Gambhir for the first time as the duo hits the drawing board to build a team for the ICC Champions Trophy in 2025.
The team is a perfect mix of youth and experience, and fans are eager to see the Men in Blue bring home another piece of silverware.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Head-to-head records in ODIs: Sri Lanka and India have played 168 matches each, with Sri Lanka winning 57 and India winning 99. There has been 1 tie and 11 no results.
Most runs in ODIs between the teams: Sanath Jayasuriya with 2899 runs for Sri Lanka and Sachin Tendulkar with 3113 runs for India.
Most wickets in ODIs between the teams: Muthiah Muralidaran with 74 wickets for Sri Lanka and Zaheer Khan with 66 wickets for India.
